alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 4:28PM EDT until July 19 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Northern City of Chesapeake in southeastern Virginia... The Southeastern City of Norfolk in southeastern Virginia... The City of Portsmouth in southeastern Virginia... The Northwestern City of Virginia Beach in southeastern Virginia... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Virginia Beach, Kempsville, Virginia Wesleyan University, Regent University, Norfolk State University, Downtown Norfolk, Downtown Portsmouth, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Norfolk International, Norview, Cradock, Princess Anne Plaza, Gallups Corner, Bayside, London Bridge, Greenbrier, Oceana NAS and Oceana. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Virginia Beach
